bibliography: W. Eisenhut, RhM 112 (1969), p. 114-119; idem, Dictys Cretensis, Leipzig, 1973, p. 140; A.E. Peristerakis, Dictys ho Krês, 1984, p. 90-92; H. Mette, Lustrum 27 (1985), p. 35-36; S. Merkle, Die Ephemeris, 1989, p. 113-118; N. Pellé, 'A proposito di Nireo e Peneleo nel Bellum Troianum di Ditti Cretese: POxy XXXI 2539?', in M. Capasso (ed.), Dal restauro dei materiali allo studio dei testi. Aspetti della ricerca papirologica (PLup 11/2002), Galatina 2003, p. 79-86.

twn uper Eurupulou
tois Trwsin did
qayantes pempousi
sullegontai de kai Phnelew kai Nirews
ostea apo ths puras eis ta skafh th de
exhs paraginetai Xrushs eis tous Ellhnwn basileis
apaggellwn Elenon ton Priamou pareinai
en tw Apollwnos ierw feugonta dia Alexandron
asebhsanta eis ton qeon a maqontes oi basileis
Diomhdhn kai Odussea propempousin autou epi
sullhyin elqousin de autois paradidwsin auton
proaitoumenos ou menwn
basilewn edoxen kalesantwn de pros tas nhas
paraginetai mh
ese
goneis
esomen

eteim
para Anthnori
ginwskwn hlika kaka

author: Dictys Cretensis
contents: extract from the Greek original of Dictys Cretensis' Bellum Troianum (= IV, 18).
propernames: Eurypylos; Trôes [Trojans]; Pêneleôs;Nireus (R); Chrysês; Hellênes [Greeks] (Q); Helenos; Priamos (R); Apollôn; Diomêdês; Odysseus; Alexandros; Antênôr.
mythological: Eurypylos; Trôes [Trojans]; Pêneleôs; Nireus (R); Chrysês; Hellênes [Greeks] (Q); Helenos; Priamos (R); Apollôn; Diomêdês; Odysseus; Alexandros; Antênôr.
frontback: faded traces of a few letters (bookhand), date?
statepreservation: 25 lines of a column broken off on all sides.
hand: small, informal, round, leaning very slightly backward, not aiming at bilinearity, though keeping the lines straight, fairly regular, plain, closely spaced, rapidly written by a competent but not particularly careful scribe, with many ligatures and occasional cursive elements.
